website_summaries.verdict: One of the better pallet busters suitable for multiple projects.
pros: Large lifting head can tackle most pallet plank widths without cracking or breaking the wood
Steel construction and welded handle for durability
Easily busts apart decks, docks, and other disassembly projects
cons: Rare reports of the ball bearing coming apart with heavy use

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have for Pallet Projects
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Duckbill Deck Wrecker to disassemble pallets. I have used every method conceivable over the years, including: reciprocating saws, pry bars, nail removers, etc. This is the best tool ever for dismantling pallets. With a little practice, one can have a pallet completely broken down in five minutes with little effort and minimum wood splits. I have already taken apart over a hundred pallets with this tool and can tell it will last for years. I wish I would have found this tool years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Biff UTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good tool with a serious flaw
customer_reviews.text: This is one mean wrecking tool. I used it for deck removal. It just ripped the deck boards right off the screws. But and here it comes. As tough a tool as it is, the head is held on to the shaft with a little pin ball bearing device. The ball bearing fell out on the second day. Hence the head fell off. I did make a repair. When I contacted the company, they were aware of the poor design. That's it. No gee I'm sorry or we'll send you another pin. If you buy this, it will fail so be prepared to make an in field repair.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Payne

customer_reviews.title: If you work with pallets, this is a must have tool
customer_reviews.text: Pallets normally take me between 20 and 30 minutes to break down - not counting nail removal time which adds about 5-10 depending on amount With this tool, I can break down a pallet in less than 5 minutes and remove nails with a total of 15 minutes tops! If you work with pallets, this is a must have tool
customer_reviews.author: Jes

customer_reviews.title: Pulls even the screwed down type boards like nothing, my 10-year old even popped a few ...
customer_reviews.text: I normally don't write reviews but felt compelled to do so with this tool. This is one of those I wish I had sooner type tools, I've pulled decks apart with a crow bar and know how much work they are. With this tool I ripped out all the deck boards of a 20x15 screwed down deck in about 30 minutes! Pulls even the screwed down type boards like nothing, my 10-year old even popped a few boards up himself as tool give good leverage.
customer_reviews.author: Junk Buster

customer_reviews.title: Must-Have for Deck Refurbishment/Demolition
customer_reviews.text: Believe the youtube videos. This deck wrecking tool is amazing. Struck up a conversation with a contractor refurbishing a neighbor's deck. He said this tool is invaluable to his crew. He was spot on. I've been redoing my home's 2-story deck and this tool is AWESOME. Removed 30 12-ft deck boards in 15 minutes. The power of the leverage does most of the work--not a lot of muscle required. I'd give it 10 stars if I could. Go buy this!
customer_reviews.author: D. Cauley

customer_reviews.title: Like butta!
customer_reviews.text: This is my new favorite tool! I make things out of old pallets, and breaking them up was always a chore. The Deck Wrecker made the job easy-and fun-and I'm a girl!
customer_reviews.author: Info Pro

customer_reviews.title: A must for deck demolition
customer_reviews.text: I am a contractor and bought this on a whim about a year and a half ago when I knew I had a couple of deck resurface jobs coming up. I forgot I had it in the truck for the first hour of the job, after some frustration and grumbling on how long it would take to demo the decking I remembered I had bought it and brought it out. We finished the demo in an hour, saving at least four hours of hard backbreaking work. This tool is amazing! You can easily pull decking that has been screwed or nailed down quickly and easily. This is a time and back saver!
customer_reviews.author: Johnson Family

customer_reviews.title: Breaking down pallets? This IS the tool
customer_reviews.text: Tried the reciprocating saw, wrecking bars, hammer & chisel, etc. and a few months ago bought a Pallet Buster | Deck Wrecker and been beating myself up breaking down pallets. Had enough and a few days ago I ordered a Duckbill Deck Wrecker. WOW, what a difference. This design really works. Broke down a few pallets and so far, broken wood and only splits I have seen were that before I started. This tool is faster and easier to use and anything I have tried. I can break down a pallet in half the time it was taking with the Pallet Buster. If you work with pallets, this is the tool you need. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Y.

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The internet even rates this tool high. Excited to try this on a couple of pallets. The legs are too short to fully fit completely under the slate. So on the ends only one leg fits under so as you pry it splits. Middle board where both legs fit under works fine. Legs of tool are very narrow and don't support the slates very well when prying. I'd think a tool that has 1" wide legs and reach all the way under would be a better choice. This was not cheap for a tool that does not perform like even people on this review section are reporting.
customer_reviews.author: G. Segadi

customer_reviews.title: BELIEVE the ratings. This thing is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I had a 12' x 23 ' deck with screwed down 2x6 boards. The deck has been down for ~20 years so the decking needed to be replaced badly. This tool made short work of the demolition. It required far more effort to move the 12ft board after popping it up than actually removing it. Most of the screws just pulled right through the boards. If I had a helper to get the boards out of the way I would have been done in <30 minutes. Took me much longer to go back with a grinder and cut off all the left over screws in the joists.
customer_reviews.author: Hex92

customer_reviews.title: It wrecks, has a duckbill and a thick handle, that I did not break.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to wreck (lol) a 16x16 deck. I started at 0930 and all the boards were up by 1200. I feel it would have went faster if the deck boards were not screwed in, but the wrecker, wrecked them screws. No problems pulling the 3" ers out. Was a great purchase, and once you get rolling it is controlled choas. I just wish, the handle was about 6 inches longer I am 6'3" so alot of bending. But overall great product, and the product details are perfect, it does what it says it wrecks, and it has a duckbill. The handle is great, and I break everything, I managed to break a sledgehammer handle afterr I used the wrecker.
customer_reviews.author: BTG05

customer_reviews.title: Magnificent
customer_reviews.text: Terrific tool, was able to demolish a 1000SF deck, removing entire 20 foot boards intact without splintering. Only at the railings was I unable to straddle a joist with the tool. The weakness is the lynch pin holding the duckbill head to the handle. It fell out on me once and fell 10 feet to the ground underneath the deck. I love being able to stand upright rather than crawling around on my haunches with a crowbar during demolition. Worth every penny of the 90 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Aurelio McKweon

customer_reviews.title: Beast!
customer_reviews.text: I had to tear up 1000 s.f. of 5/4 pressure treated decking that I SCREWED down 20 years ago when I built my deck. I was trying to demo with 2 foot crowbar before the deck wrecker arrived and that was slow and involved a lot of hammering. The deck wrecker made a huge difference, I still needed a bit of muscle and technique but it worked great. Some screws came out with the board, and some remained- but I pulled up with a crowbar.
customer_reviews.author: Technetium 99m

customer_reviews.title: Deck Wrecher Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: This product is so easy to use and lives up to it's name. Deck Wrecker! My 15 year old found it on YouTube. Watched the video and ordered it off of Amazon. He used it to remove all of the boards on a 700 sq. ft. deck in two hours. Took me 15 minutes to remove one with a sledgehammer. Only issue is with the pin that holds the head on. It is a Ball detent pin. Within minutes of use the ball fell out. We quickly replaced the ball with a cotter pin and it works great. May want to change your pin choice.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Wooldridge

customer_reviews.title: Received yesterday
customer_reviews.text: Received this wrecking bar yesterday ... tore up about a third of a 34x10x25 "L" covered porch tongue-and-groove flooring. Wrecking bar worked as advertised -- short learning curve. The only weakness I have found so far is the pin that holds the head on the handle assembly, as I've seen others complain about. It has a detent ball that is supposed to keep the pin from migrating out, which worked OK until the detent ball itself fell out of its socket. I was able to drill the ball socket thru and use a cotter pin to secure it. Otherwise I'm happy with the product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur C. Striker

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Tool!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tool! Was replacing the boards on my deck and the project was going very slow. The previous owners of the house used screws and managed to strip all of them (and cover them in a thick layer of paint.) Trying to use a pry-bar and un-screwing was not working very well. I looked on Amazon and found this. Was worried that it wasn't going to work well, especially since it isn't cheap! But once I got it, it exceeded expectations! Made the work much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Jeewan S. Ghuman

customer_reviews.title: A one trick pony, but worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Worked excellent! Very sturdy, very well-built. If you have a decent size deck (in my case it was over 600 ft.2) this tool is worth every penny. Saved me hours of backbreaking labor. I tried it for a while the hard way using a crowbar and it was clear that I need a better way. This is especially helpful if your boards are held in with ring shank nails, as these are even tougher to pull out. I probably will never use this tool again, but it was totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J Barker

customer_reviews.title: Works very well at its intended task.
customer_reviews.text: On the day I received it I used it to remove some Trex deck boards that I attached over 17 years ago using 3 inch gold diggers. Recently I tried using a large nail puller and it was very difficult. Using the Deck Wrecker was much easier. It’s really only good for its intended purpose, which is peeling decking when the Deck Wrecker can straddle the joist and get its tines most or all of the way under the deck board, but in that case it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it for pallets, maybe something else But no Pallets!
customer_reviews.text: Did not work on Pallets like I had hoped. Just ripped them apart so the boards were no of no use. Ruined many pallets this way until I said to heck with it and put it away. May use for something else, don't know what. It is nice heavy quality and easy to put together, BUT I would not recommend using on Pallets, it just rips the boards so they are no use to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: Best product ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Me a 115 lb woman had to show my husband a business owner and engineer how to use this. He said i was going to throw it across room. I said why he said cause it doesn't work. I said here let me show you. IT WAS SO SIMPLE. I took a pallet apart in less 10 mins all by myself first time using without breaking a single board. This us amazing. Worth way more than what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: You gotta get it!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical but this thing is amazing. Little effort and with some good placement 99% of the boards came off perfectly. Super simple and worth every penny. I would pay this much alone just to not have the aggravation of using a hammer and chisel! definitely buy it! Some people say it’s too heavy but yes, that’s what makes it easy to use. The weight does it for you. Yes it has a fiberglass handle but you don’t need to use so much force that it would ever come close to breaking. Just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: firepipes24

customer_reviews.title: What a video on Youtube etc. to see exactly how it works BEFORE using it
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use for ripping out the old boards on a deck I'm rebuilding. At first I thought I had wasted my money because I was not using it properly. After watching a video (Youtube), I realized that the tool is designed to fit over the deck (or floor) joist and then simply using the leverage advantage of the long handle to pry the board up. Using it properly, the tool was MUCH more effective than standard pry bars/wrecking bars. So far, it has also held up quite well.
customer_reviews.author: P. Byrnes

customer_reviews.title: This is a Monster Tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this deck destroyer based on Amazon views and watching a few youtube videos. To say that this tool is good, is truly an understatement. I am 66 years old and removed a 10x20 15 year old cedar deck with shank nails in 60 minutes. This deck had 45 deck boards and I was removing each board in about 90 seconds. The only slight draw back, is that this tool is do powerful in removing the boards that it leaves the majority of the nails still in the joist. Still this wasn't a issue because with my cordless reciprocating saw and a good Lenox blade, I cut all the nails in about 45 minutes. REALLY AWESOME TOOL!
customer_reviews.author: SAL COSTA

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool for sure.
customer_reviews.text: It works great. Heavy duty construction. But, they put a pin in the pronged head of the bar. I assume to disassemble it for travel. But the pin didn't have a hole in it to put a cotter key through it. So that the head wouldn't fall off while using it! So I drilled a hole put a cotter key in it and now I can work with out stopping. Don't know if that was typical or just a mistake. But it was an easy enough fix. And I am very happy with the tool.
customer_reviews.author: shaw10873

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: The duckbill popped up 5/4" deck boards like butter. These boards were nailed down, so I don't have any experience using this bar on screwed down decking. I would imagine it would just snap the boards which would then allow you to deal with the screws. For my project this was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Varley not Farley

customer_reviews.title: Life Changer! Avid DIY builder!
customer_reviews.text: To say I LOVE THIS is an understatement! I can rip down a pallet in two minutes or less. If you’ve ever attempted to break down a pallet, you know that Pinterest LIED to you!!! You’ll break 3/4 of the boards and spend a solid hour or more. Hopefully soon I can share a video of me takin down a few pallets. It’s so efficient that i would recommend sanding your pallet while it’s together (avoiding nails and screws) as the boards don’t move this way and THEN dismantle it. Just one more way to reduce work times!
customer_reviews.author: RunninTheGoodRace

customer_reviews.title: The original deck/pallet wrecker - sturdy and well built
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the price. After looking at other models/types, we decided on the ‘original’ and glad we did. This thing is beefy, and super well built! Makes easy work of stripping deck boards and pallets. We work in a team - one wrecks the other removes fasteners. As for the seller - quick shipping, prompt follow up after receipt.
customer_reviews.author: Adventures Downeast

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast! As a home DIYer, I know that the secret is to not only use the right tool, but to use the best tool. This thing is definitely not only the right tool, but the best tool for the job. And as a 64 year old, I have no idea how I would rip the deck boards off my deck without this thing. Whoever built this deck didn't use nails; they used spikes. And this tool is ripping right through the job! This thing is a beast!
customer_reviews.author: PSebelist

customer_reviews.title: 100% Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny if you have to pry up old deck boards. Quite a few boards on our deck were rotting or splintered and had to come up. I was worried it wouldn't work because they were screwed in (versus nailed in), but they came up quickly. This might not be the same story if the deck boards were in good shape. Although, about half the time, the screws would stay embedded in the underlying deck beams. We would then just use locking pliers to twist out the screws. Still ten times easier and faster than trying to dig out old rusty, stripped screws.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Makepeace

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tool!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband says that this is worth every penny!! We started tearing off our deck which is over 700 square foot and screwed down. In 3 hours time before the deck wrecker, we removed 3-4 boards! I began to look on you tube to see if there were any videos on how to “easily” removed screwed on deck boards. Low and behold I found the video on the duckbill deck wrecker!!! I ordered it and we (he) is so glad that we did. In a few hours(maybe 7 or 8) and not work solid on it,(a few hours in the evenings) we have it half way torn off!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Man is this way easier than beating boards off of pallets with a hammer! I won't say that every board comes off with ease or doesn't split...have you seen some of the twisted nails they put those things together with!? Still, this made some pallet projects way easier for me in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: W. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Really is a BACK saver
customer_reviews.text: This is a REAL WINNER. I read where others had demo'd their deck with less effort. Neighbor ask me to resurface her 12x12 deck - took less than an hour to remove 22 boards (however, it was easy because the builder used non-galvanized nails - what an idiot). My deck (which I need to tackle next) has 2 1/2" galvanized twisted nails, we'll see how this tool handles them. I'm expecting good things because of the angle/torque you can get with tool.
customer_reviews.author: Bluegw

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The Duck Billed Deck Wrecker is well engineered to remove boards from a deck. All the boards I have removed were screwed, not nailed (it's probably so much faster with nailed boards.) It takes about 2 minutes max to remove an 8-10 foot screwed-in board. Sometimes the screws remain in the board, sometimes the screws remain in the joists below. I use a curved pry bar to remove the screws that are left behind in the joists. The duck bill shaped head is very solid. I don't worry about it breaking. The handle is long enough to get a lot of leverage. The combination of the long handle and the well engineered head is what makes this tool so effective.
customer_reviews.author: Jaron M. Asher

customer_reviews.title: Wish I knew about this months ago
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at how easily this tool broke apart pallets! It is a little heavy, but that’s is to be expected considering how pallets are made. I did discover that you should always start with the middle nails on each pallet, then the outside ones. The boards are less likely to split and break that way.
customer_reviews.author: kstephens

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: My contractor started to remove my deck and in the first six hours of work he had removed 10 boards. He was hammering a crowbar 20 times with a sledge just to get the board started at every joint. He had never seen deck boards nailed with 6” nails, 3 per board at each joint. I googled and found the duckbill and shipped it in one day. It arrived and used it on the next board and had it lifted in 5 minutes without pounding or raising a sweat. Duckbill has saved me well over $1500 in demolition extra cost. I donated the duckbill to the contractor and now he swears by it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Fisk

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a deck wrecking machine. I had two 1000+SF decks to R&R the decking on. I started the process with hammers and pry-bars, what a waste of time. This tool is very well made and made and saved my back as well as loads of time.
customer_reviews.author: sightljj

customer_reviews.title: Wish I Knew About this Sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time without this! I started my deck board replacement project a few weeks before seeing this online. Before purchasing the DDW, it would take me longer to remove the old board than installing the new one. It now takes less than a minute to remove a 16' board that was secured with 3" screws! Best money spent on a tool in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Reduced the demolition time by half...
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my back deck boards, and this tool works so good I was able to complete the job in two days versus the four planned. This tool was so sturdy and the leverage from the long handle made removal of boards easy. Once you get the first board out, you are off and running.
customer_reviews.author: hawk158

customer_reviews.title: Heck yes!
customer_reviews.text: Great way to save your back and arms. Pried a couple of Trex boards off a deck we were destroying happily and knew there had to be a better way. Deck Wrecker was easy to use and fast. All the leverage you could wish for. Males and females will love making destruction happen with this beast. Only wish it was able to carry the boards to the dumpster as well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sleutel-Robinson

customer_reviews.title: the deck wrecker !
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend "The Deck Wrecker" for anyone, pro's and do it yourselfers if you ever plan on pulling deck boards, or removing boards. This Bar is very well built,you can change the claw head to work best from one end to the last end of the deck, just pull a pin and change directions of the head!! I had a 8ft. X 22ft. deck removed in about 1 hour. The boards and nails were no problem
customer_reviews.author: RCJR

customer_reviews.title: You will not regret purchasing this tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have if you demolishing a deck. My boards were screwed in, and I was unable to remove the screws without stripping the heads. This tool worked great. It easily allows the boards to be popped out and leaves the screws in. I did have to use an angle grinder to cut the remaining screws flush to the structure below. Much much much easier than going at it with a hammer and pry bars.
customer_reviews.author: B. Purvis

customer_reviews.title: Works on screwed down or nailed decks
customer_reviews.text: I used this to demo a large wood deck. The deck had been installed, modified added to over course of 34 years and included nailed and screwed down standard wood planks and 2X6 decking. The duckbill deck wrecker was effective in lifting up all of the deck material regardless of nails or screws or thickness of the decking. It was a definite time saver. Would highly recommend if you have a deck demo job.
customer_reviews.author: GrandPa Tuck

customer_reviews.title: Best I have found for removing deck boards
customer_reviews.text: This thing works like a charm. The only thing it doesn't do is pull out the nails when the board is removed but once they come off there is much easier access to the nails so they can be pulled easily. I told the manager local tool rental store about them and he is buying two for his stores.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Busse

customer_reviews.title: Best tool ever!
customer_reviews.text: We started our deck remodel with mini sledgehammers and pry bars. After 3 boards, we realized that it was going to take forever! I looked online and found this tool so we paused our project for two days. We started again with our Duckbill Deck Wrecker and a few hours later the deck boards were removed with no damage to our support structure. The best $90 we have ever spent!
customer_reviews.author: D Jones

customer_reviews.title: The Deck Wrecker was just awesome! The old boards came up with little effort
customer_reviews.text: We recently purchased a home with an old elevated deck which was about 600 square feet in size. The boards were installed without space between them and also had tongue & groove ends. Some of the deck was beginning to rot. The Deck Wrecker was just awesome! The old boards came up with little effort. Turning the head was also used at certain points. For us, it was likely a once in a lifetime use of this tool but it was worth its weight in gold just to get the deck up. I would recommend anyone doing this job to get one of these! Thanks for making our life easier!
customer_reviews.author: Guido

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.  Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This produce is rock solid and saved a great deal of time when taking apart our old deck, which was 25x25. We started with crowbar and hammer, and quickly realized that would take forever. The duckbill deck wrecker allowed us to get the job done in a fraction of the time. Worth the money if you value your time.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Make deck demolition easy!
customer_reviews.text: Made short work of decking that was screwed in 15 years ago. Once you get an open space to get the jaws in place, you’re good to go. Only caveat is you need room to lever the decking up. At the edge, this is a problem. Time for your crowbar and hammer.
customer_reviews.author: loubeau

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing tool. I use it for taking apart pallets and we used it for dismantling an office. So glad I found this, if I hadn't I would of left all the pallets sit. In just a few minutes you can have a pallet taken apart. Again this will save your back if you take pallets apart
customer_reviews.author: Harley Diva

customer_reviews.title: Need to replace your deck boards?  Get this tool!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always agreed with the old adage, the right tool for the right job. For deck replacement, the Duckbill Deck Wrecker is the right tool. As you can see it was easy to leverage the deck boards up from the joists. Definitely a tool I would not be without when demolishing a deck.
customer_reviews.author: Randy C Marks

customer_reviews.title: The Person that invented this needs a Metal!!
customer_reviews.text: We were anxious about how we were going to remove our old deck boards. Bought this tool and we so surprised at how well it worked!! 20x16 deck was wrecked in record time and with ease!! Can not say enough about how well this works!
customer_reviews.author: Suzie

customer_reviews.title: Best way to deconstruct pallets!
customer_reviews.text: This product is simple and ingenious. I like to use pallets to make projects, and I had been using sawzalls for the deconstruction. Burning through many blades and getting blisters. Decided to give this a try. I love it!! This is my new favorite tool! It's easy to use and self explanatory on how to use. Can take the pin out to change the angle as needed. Money well spent for me to disassemble pallets. Makes it much easier to remove nails as well vs when I was using sawzall. I highly recommend the Duckbill deck wrecker!!
customer_reviews.author: Leigh O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Makes a tough job less tough
customer_reviews.text: Used product to Remove screwed down 2x6 decking. Made a miserable job measurably less miserable. Lots of the screws stayed in place and had to broken off or bent over. Irregardless it’s difficult to imagine doing the job with out this tool.The screws crammed out when using a screw gun
customer_reviews.author: Carson 123

customer_reviews.title: The right tool for the task
customer_reviews.text: I just received the Deckwreaker today and took it on its maiden voyage. It performed as advertised and made the removal of nailed weather pressured decking a much easier task than a hammer and crow bar. The four foot length of the lever and the design of the claw foot is an ingenious application of classical physics to a modern problem. While it is nor a tool that has multiple applications, it is certainly an elegant solution for the arduous task of deck removal and worth every penny for the toil, time, and back ache it saves.
customer_reviews.author: Russ B

customer_reviews.title: Easily removes deck boards!
customer_reviews.text: Had a rust spot. But I was able to tear down my deck easily and I’m a female. Now that I don’t need it may have to sell it because I’m not sure what else I can use it for besides a deck i no longer have. I did use it to break into my clay dirt while I was planting.
customer_reviews.author: Lena

customer_reviews.title: Thought I was buying a new tool; received a used tool
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box and was obvious the tool was used. The logo on the handle was partially worn and the end had use scratches on it. There was a sticker on the handle that said ‘used, very good’. The tool wasn’t in bad shape, but I thought I was buying new. I have reviewed the listing and still dot see a disclosure that it is a used tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Time and effort saver, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Went from removing a screwed on wood deck 8X8 area in 4 hours to removing the remaining entire 16X20 deck in just over an hour. I love tools and really love this one and want everyone to know what a time and effort saver it is. Great great tool and i will be bragging to my co worker today. Not sure what else I will use it for but this one is a keeper and waiting to be loned out to impress my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Stone

customer_reviews.title: Makes quick work of deck demo
customer_reviews.text: Short of a bull dozer, this puppy is the quickest way to demo a deck. Doesn't work quite as well if your boards are on a 45, but still does a good job. It also puts a bit of a point load on the joists if that is of concern for you. Even if this is a one time use item, it will save your back from all the crow bar work... i would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Pearson

customer_reviews.title: We are SOooo happy we found this
customer_reviews.text: Don't even think about it! Buy this tool! You will save days of work and your back with the deckwrecker. We are SOooo happy we found this. Otherwise, we would've probably given up and hired someone to take apart our 24' x 16' deck! Like another reviewer said, we were able to pop off our old cedar decking and stairs "like butter". And after all that, the tool still looks brand new!
customer_reviews.author: brontefan

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done quickly!
customer_reviews.text: This tool got he job done quick and with very little effort! Well worth the money removing my 2x6 deck boards that were nailed in.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G.

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I really don't like is that the pin comes out. I replaced it with a small bolt and lock nut.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Kornegay

customer_reviews.title: Extremely well-engineered tool
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, we were half done with resurfacing a very large deck before we obtained the Duckbill deck wrecker. It is an extremely well-engineered tool which has saved my husband a substantial amount of time and work. It very quickly lifted 2x6s held by both screws and nails.
customer_reviews.author: Martha H

customer_reviews.title: Best analogy.
customer_reviews.text: This thing has already paid for itself today replacing a deck on my rental property. There is a special place in hell for the designer of ring shank deck nails. The Duckbill made short work of this, and I did it without bending over, being on my knees and with one hand. Best analogy...cutting through butter with a hot knife. VITUALLY EFFORTLESS. Saved me 10 hours and a lot of aches and pains. GREAT PRODUCT and I almost never leave reviews unless I feel very strongly about a product...this one exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: William Hinz

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.... but factory quality control needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: The Duckbill Deck Wrecker makes tearing apart pallets quick and easy. It salvages many boards intact that would be easily destroyed using a small wrecking bar or traditional crow bar with hammer. The leverage created by the long handle makes light of demolition work. The single compliant that I have it that the manufacturer drop shipped the brand new tool to me with a rubber handle cover that was cracked and split open. That is very poor quality control for a tool costing $80. Makes me wonder what other quality issues are being overlooked before shipping out the door.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deck remover
customer_reviews.text: The deck I was removing was 2x6 boards in good condition. Found out that I had to saw the boards into 4 foot lengths so I was only removing two joists of board at a time. In my case, was not as easy as the videos show. The tool worked well and I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: George W. Barbato

customer_reviews.title: Best deck puller ever!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is fantastic! The long forks get deep under the boards to pull them up very evenly. It works in pretty tight spaces. It is very heavy steel so it doesn't flex at all and doesn't require a lot of effort to crank up the tightest boards (even ones that are side nailed too). A final cool feature is the fact that you can quickly reverse the angle of the tool from a push to a pull configuration - which is very handy when you get near a wall.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: JUST BUY IT! IT IS THE TOOL YOU NEED FOR THAT JOB!
customer_reviews.text: I'm tearing down a huge deck that used to be around my swimming pool. Don't hesitate to get this if you need to remove decking or break down pallets. This is a back, knee, and time saver. I tore down many decks and removed a lot of flooring when I worked for a salvage company; this tool is a game changer.
customer_reviews.author: T. Chandler

customer_reviews.title: The inventor I hope is a gazillionaire!
customer_reviews.text: Best device invented in the history on man! I was killing myself pulling up existing 18 year version one 20 foot Trex decking with a long crow bar and sledge hammer......it was back braking. Stumbled on this on Amazon as I was purchasing other deck materials and saw the overwhelming reviews...like 600+ 5 stars! It makes pulling up existing deck sooooooooooooo much easier. What I know now after using it...it could be double the price and I would still buy it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I needed to remove my decking due some rot and to replace with composite. My deck had been screwed down and covered with Restore so the screw heads were not accessible. I tried using several pry bars and it was taking forever to get them up. This tool made removal 1000% easier. My only compaint is that they didn't integrate a nail puller into the design. Had they, I'd have gone eight stars.
customer_reviews.author: James T.

customer_reviews.title: What a tool!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for myself (I am a female) while creating a pallet project (my little hobby), saved me A LOT of time and A LOT of energy! And for homeowners who needs deck replacing... Save money on labor costs and DIY with the "Duckbill Deck Wrecker" {in my best southern accent) =)~ It's that easy!
customer_reviews.author: TeenaB

customer_reviews.title: Look no further,this is what youv'e been looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Have a 40 X 16 deck that needed new deck boards and railing. Each board had 21 old spiral rusted nails in it. It was close to a hundred boards. Pulled a few the old fashioned way on my hands and knees with wrecking bar and hammer. To put it mildly it flat out sucked. Had to be an easier way. This is it, hands down the way to do it. Worth it's weight in gold. Thank You!. My friend saw it in action and needs to reside a barn.
customer_reviews.author: NutCase

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tool, almost too easy to use!! Who ever came up with this tool needs a raise and promotion. Went through 9 standard pallets in 45 min and my back did not hurt one bit. Highly recommend to anyone who works with pallets or is using the pallets for projects or just fire wood. This will give you a work out , but your back wont be yelling at you when you are done.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Nimmo

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me!
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak for decks yet, but for pallets this tool is the tool to use. Sure you can use a sawzall and cut through nails, but then you have nail heads to deal with. I've seen a ton of complaints here, but I don't have any! I have found a way that works for me and I'm sticking to it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Shields

customer_reviews.title: Buy this tool today!
customer_reviews.text: What a great tool! I removed the deck boards on almost half of my deck with a pry bar and hammer and it was an awful job. Then I decided to order the Deck Wrecker and it was a breeze! No more broken boards flying in my face and the job was done in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Jim O.

customer_reviews.title: fast delivery.
customer_reviews.text: This tool does exactly what it says it will do. If you use it with reasonable care it will take boards off of a pallet very easily. Garbage boards will probably break but I am able to salvage a reasonable amount. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: dpm

customer_reviews.title: Great time saving tool
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool. Used it to pry apart pallets for a major project. This tool saved me a ton of time. Easy enough that my 12 year old was able to help with ease.
customer_reviews.author: 6 Geese

customer_reviews.title: TIME-SAVER!
customer_reviews.text: You can probably manufacturer your own tool but I chose to purchase this one. It saved many hours of work pulling nails! Great idea and worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: buckeyepetey

customer_reviews.title: Best pallet busting tool ever
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a total time saver--I wish I had bought it sooner! Now I can use the entire length of each board and I don't have nails that have been cut with my reciprocating saw still stuck in the wood. This pulls the nails out with the boards, too. I broke down about 8 pallets in very little time. I'm so glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Daley

customer_reviews.title: It is simple and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. If you need to remove several deck boards, mine are 2x6s ,it is wonderful. Once you you remove the first board you can average about one minute a board on 16 footers. I highly recommend this tool
customer_reviews.author: The Goat

customer_reviews.title: 1 Awesome Tool!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you don't buy this tool your crazy. I single handedly tore the decking boards off of a 20x10 deck in 1 hour. Buy this and thank me later!! Update Sept 15 2017 A buddy of mine has been procrastinating on tearing his deck boards off. His deck is 25 x 15. Long story short, I showed up Saturday and 2 hours later the job was done. Buy it already.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Great for pallets...just wish
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome way to break down pallets! Quick and easy! The reason I gave it 4 is because the prongs are not long enough for a 5 foot pallet board. They should make an extension for it!!!
customer_reviews.author: CelticLady56

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with the Deck Wrecker. Tore up deck board that were screwed down, either broke the screws or the screws pulled through the deck boards, staying in the joists. This tool turned a difficult job into a piece of cake.
customer_reviews.author: E. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Oh man. This thing is the bee's knee's! ...
customer_reviews.text: Oh man. This thing is the bee's knee's! I started pulling apart my pallet with a crow bar and hammer as I waited for this tool to come. I gave up after 5 minutes. Got this thing yesterday and had my pallet torn apart in 10 minutes. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi E.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Hammers, sledges, crow bars and even a sawzall did not work for me. I bought this and so glad I did. Sawzall would have worked if the joints weren't so tight. Getting through wood and nails even with demo blades was a chore and rough on back and arms. This tool will only take a few minutes longer and once you get the hang of it you can remove undamaged boards whole and ready to use. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Rylsngrd

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool...very sturdy and maked the job easy.
customer_reviews.text: I started removing my deck boards with a hammer and crow bar which was taking 2 or 3 minutes per board and was killing my back. I saw the Deck Wrecker advertised online thought I would give it a try. I had pulled 10 boards the hard way (approx 1/2 hr)....then I pulled the remaining 90 boards with the Deck Wrecker tool in less than I hour. Great tool .....My back thanks you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It easily does a goo job.
customer_reviews.text: I tested this by removing boards from pallets. I have a pallet busting tool that will also remove the slaps but it splinters the boards 99% of the time. The Duck Bill tool is far easier to use, less effort, and have not cracked a board yet. Its all in the head geometry and I was about to weld up my own when I found this one. A nail pulling function would be nice but not sure how to incorporate that into the design. 5 stars for sure.
customer_reviews.author: stephen m.

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to demo a decks flooring this is a must have... it pulls boards right off nails and screws with little effort... made demoing a 500 sq ft deck take about 2 hours instead of an entire day of work
customer_reviews.author: Brian S. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I could have bought
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I could have bought!!! Pallets break down in a snap, even those with the twisted nails. I used to break about 1/2 the planks when I used a hammer and crowbar. Not with this. I can now completely break a pallet down in about 5 min or so with no trouble and keep all of the wood. Doesn't work so great on 4x4 cross beams but those with a standard 2x4 it rips apart easily. Great tool!!!
customer_reviews.author: kdowd771

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely a must have
customer_reviews.text: Im in the middle of demo on a 500 square foot second story deck built in the late 80s. Not only does the wrecker pull boards off 5x as fast as a hammer and pry bar, it keeps everything in one piece and takes the nails out with the wood. I've had it for two days and three people have asked if they could borrow it. The claw part is solid, the handle is a little shorter than the handle on a shovel. The best tool I've bought in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool so far
customer_reviews.text: I own a carpentry business was a little skeptical of this product at first bc of price. Works great takes up decking with ease. Worth the investment if your trying to save your back and increase productivity. Beats beating the decking boards up with a sledgehammer or spud-bar from below on higher decks or even cutting up into sections. Will be buying another after I use this awhile to be sure of quality. At first glance and 2nd deck use this seems to be a lasting product.
customer_reviews.author: jesse harris

customer_reviews.title: All Around Outstanding Tool
customer_reviews.text: Even with spiral shanked nails, I was able to easily remove 450 sq/ft of treated decking. Before going online and purchasing the Duckbill Deck Wrecker, I was getting quickly exhausted trying to free up individual boards. I discovered the tool on YouTube. This tool is so sturdy that, having completed the whole project, other than marring the coated finish on the two tines that pry up the boards, it looks brand new. It's a great, must have, tool!
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool!
customer_reviews.text: If you are tearing down an old deck this is an awesome tool to pop off the old beck boards. Fast and fun too! No way you could bend or break it.
customer_reviews.author: Secretcitynative

customer_reviews.title: Deck board removal beast.
customer_reviews.text: This tool allowed 1 person to remove 16 nailed down 14' long deck boards in about 30 minutes in 90 degree sunny weather. It may or may not get the edges depending on deck construction but very easy to get the rest of them. I wasted too much time using normal 7 bars and sludge hammers prior to getting this. Yes it is a little costly but it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Clendening

customer_reviews.title: This would work great for tearing apart pallets also
customer_reviews.text: Thought this was a little high priced but after using it, it was money well spent. Our deck is about 15 years old and was screwed down so it left about half of the screws in the deck. The screws that were pulled out did do a little damage but not much. Would not want to tear up a deck without this tool! This would work great for tearing apart pallets also.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Pauley

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Will easily dismantle with a lot of bending and positioning, but doesn't salvage well. Splits most boards.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick C.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This tool worked really well and made tearing up the deck a much better process. I would have given it 5 stars except for one concern. I have used it only on one deck but the fiberglass handle is already showing some signs of stress cracks. These began to appear about half way through the deck removal. I continued to use it but was prepared for it to break. Fortunately it did not. I am not sure how long the handle will last but should it actually break I guess I will replace it with something more substantial for future use.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Best Deck Demo Tool Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I had to get some foundation work done and needed to take down our deck immediately to allow the contractors access. This tool is pretty costly but is well worth it. I was able to remove the decking in no time flat. The decking was fastened to the joists by large screws that look similar to ones used for drywall. These screws did not even phase the Duckbill Deck Wrecker! The head of the tool swivels so that you can change the attack angle. The jaws of the Duckbill Deck Wrecker fit nicely around the joists. Someone put a lot of time and effort into designing this tool.
customer_reviews.author: John Boy

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and vertical.
customer_reviews.text: I am using it to tear down a barn. Works good in many different ways. Only gripe is the rubber sleeve on the handle slips. I'm sure it could be repaired with some kind of rubber cement.
customer_reviews.author: David Newsum

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for pallets!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool! We break down pallets for various projects and this tool has cut down the effort greatly. I don't want to say it's effortless, but it takes seconds to pull a board up (typically whole) vs 10-20 minutes with a wonder bar.
customer_reviews.author: J.R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Worth EVERY SINGLE PENNY
customer_reviews.text: Worth EVERY SINGLE PENNY once you get the hang of it you can do some serious work....Mine was missing the "Pin" everyone talks about i just threw in a 1/4 20 bolt and off i went... Very well engineered tool one handed you can move boards and after awhile you get to learn the tool so you can pop the boards up balance them on the tool and throw them in a pile....Here is me using it on the attic floor to rip the tongue and groove 100 year old plus.....Didn't even break a sweat...
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Quality too
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to pull apart pallets for DIY project. This definitely can pull them apart, but I was hoping the boards would remain in one piece. Yes it pulled them apart effortlessly. Just hoped for different end result.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Duckbill Deck Wrecker
product_meta.description: It's no secret that demolition can take longer than building the replacement. If you've ever tried to remove old deck boards with a pry bar and hammer you know how tedious that can be, not to mention being rough on your knees and back. Introducing the Duckbill Deck Wrecker... The Duckbill Deck Wrecker straddles a single or double 2x joist with a steel head to pry nailed or screwed boards up using maximum leverage. Equipped with a strong fiberglass handle and a padded nonslip grip, it's ready for your toughest jobs. It is not just for decks either. It can be used on roof joists, to remove wood siding, pallets and almost anywhere you need to remove boards. So what are you waiting for... Get The Duck.
feature_bullets: PATENTED DESIGN: Uses leverage to pry boards easily from floor joists. Slides under the board, straddles a single or double joist and lifts the board usually in one piece.
DISMANTLE DECKS, DOCKS, AND PALLETS IN SECONDS: The ultimate demolition tool and pallet buster.
NO MATCH: An old fashion heavy duty pry bar, nail puller or crowbar are no match for the Duckbill Deck Wrecker.
EASY TO USE: Work from standing position, not on your knees.
VERSATILE: Head rotates to allow working close to structure.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars1,007 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
